tv.source-info-name: Pluto TV Space guide by TV

programme.title: The New Frontier: Tickets Please
programme.desc: No spacecraft have traveled so fast or so close to a star before. It is hoped to reveal the source of the solar winds that effect us here on Earth

programme.title: The New Frontier: Planet X
programme.desc: The New Horizons mission continues deeper into space, it’s next target looming close.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Hyabusa
programme.desc: The Japanese Asteroid sample return mission has reached its target and is surveying the space rock ready to dip down and take a sample.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Fresh Eyes
programme.desc: Two new space telescopes are in orbit and completing their shakedown; Gaia and TESS they too will be joined by the James Webb Telescope.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Martian Attractions
programme.desc: The Latest in Martian exploration from orbit and on the ground, new sources of water and planetary dust storms are a few of the stories unfolding on to the Red Planet.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Heavy Lift
programme.desc: New heavy lift rockets are taking to the sky. Falcon Heavy, SLS, Arianne 6 and Vega C rockets are primed to begin the next phase of space expansion.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Proving Einstein
programme.desc: Some of the proof of Einstein’s theories had long been elusive, beyond the capabilities of technology, until now.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Where Are All the Aliens?
programme.desc: We’re looking hard, but the numbers aren’t stacking up, is life on other planets that hard to find? Even signals from an advanced race elude us.

programme.title: NEW EPISODES The New Frontier: Star Light, Star Bright
programme.desc: The two current science missions to our star; the sun have made great leaps forward in the science of how stars work, how they generate solar winds and how they affect their orbiting planets

programme.title: NEW EPISODES The New Frontier: Moon Shine
programme.desc: The International drive to return to the Moon is gathering pace, this multi- nation effort is readying to return, stay and utilise the Lunar assets.

programme.title: NEW EPISODES The New Frontier: Rising Tides
programme.desc: The next generation of Earth observation satellites are now in place maintaining the continuity of long-term climate data, in particular the planets rising temperatures and related ocean levels.

programme.title: NEW EPISODES The New Frontier: Earth's Evil Twin
programme.desc: Venus is a planet closest to Earth in distance and size, it once may have been as hospitable to life as Earth is now. Then something changed and Venus became shrouded in hot dense toxic clouds.

programme.title: The New Frontier: NEW EPISODES The New Frontier: Increasing Orbit
programme.desc: The ISS is the workhorse of the international spacefaring community, but its days are numbered. R

programme.title: The New Frontier: NEW EPISODES The New Frontier: Mountains in the dark
programme.desc: Asteroids, the debris from the early solar system hold tantalizing clues to planetary formation. The spacecraft Psyche readies to study a unique metallic asteroid.

programme.title: The New Frontier: NEW EPISODES The New Frontier: Oceans in the Sky
programme.desc: Juice and the Europa Clipper are two missions to our Solar System’s largest planet.

programme.title: The New Frontier: NEW EPISODES The New Frontier: Webb of Life
programme.desc: The James Webb Space Telescope is now operational. Launched aboard an Arianne 5 the 10-billion-dollar spacecraft has deployed successfully and reached its orbit around the Sun.

programme.title: The New Frontier: NEW EPISODES The New Frontier: Peering into the Abyss
programme.desc: Imaging a black hole was a breakthrough in astronomy, now with the new satellite IXPE high energy telescope we will be looking at some of the most dramatic, and most violent objects in the universe: Colliding Black holes and Neutron Stars.

programme.title: The New Frontier: NEW EPISODES The New Frontier: Next Big Leap
programme.desc: Projects in the works. SunRISE, SPHEREx, NEOS and others, their mission to expand our knowledge of Earth, the surrounding space, Dark Matter, and the earliest galaxies. N

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas
programme.desc: See the sun, moon, planets, and galaxies through the eyes of intrepid machines that are blazing a trail across the solar system. A gateway to bold adventures, these cameras are delivering spectacular new cosmic vistas.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas
programme.desc: See the sun, moon, planets, and galaxies through the eyes of intrepid machines that are blazing a trail across the solar system. A gateway to bold adventures, these cameras are delivering spectacular new cosmic vistas.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Hubble's Renaissance
programme.desc: Before we can reach space, we must first be able to see it. Hundreds of years ago, the simple telescope was used to give us a seemingly closer vantage. Today, we use the awe-inspiring, and super powerful, Hubble Space Telescope.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Superscopes
programme.desc: The human eye can only see visible light, a small spectrum of electromagnetic waves. Today, we have instruments that let us perceive all wavelengths.
